GeneDef.label: abysmal animal slayer
GeneDef.description: Due to some weird genetic manipulation of the carrier's brain, they find themselves almost incapable of dealing any notable damage to animal targets.

GeneDef.label: extremely bad animal slayer
GeneDef.description: Carriers of this gene have significant difficulty killing animals, either because of a special wiring in their brains telling them to not take the lives of animals, or just general inexplicable physical incapability not yet explained by science.

GeneDef.label: very bad animal slayer
GeneDef.description: Carriers of this gene have major issues when trying to kill animals, either because of a special wiring in their brains telling them to not take the lives of animals, or just general inexplicable physical incapability not yet explained by science.

GeneDef.label: bad animal slayer
GeneDef.description: Carriers of this gene have issues when trying to kill animals, either because of a special wiring in their brains telling them to not take the lives of animals, or just general inexplicable physical incapability not yet explained by science.

GeneDef.label: somewhat good animal slayer
GeneDef.description: Carriers of this gene instinctively know some of the weak points of any animal they fight, making it easier to kill them.

GeneDef.label: good animal slayer
GeneDef.description: Carriers of this gene instinctively know a lot of the weak points of any animal they fight, making it easier to kill them.

GeneDef.label: very good animal slayer
GeneDef.description: Carriers of this gene instinctively know most of the weak points of any animal they fight, making it easier to kill them.

GeneDef.label: extremely good animal slayer
GeneDef.description: Carriers of this gene instinctively know every weak point of any animal they fight, making it significantly easier to kill them.

GeneDef.label: unbelievably good animal slayer
GeneDef.description: Carriers of this gene instinctively know every weak point of any animal they fight and have the ability to predict where the animal will move next with a low accuracy rate, making it significantly easier to kill them.\n\nAlite's note: Predictive ability doesn't really exist or do anything, it's just some fluff text that I use to be able to claim this gene makes complete sense.
